attributes.action: Allow all widows/widowers to benefit from their partners taxes and national insurance contributions - give them their partners pension regardless of when they died, whether they are divorced etc.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: There are a number of rules in this area, and while some widows/widowers do get some 'money back', not all of them do. As far as I am aware it depends on when they died, whether you are a widow/widower, whether you got divorced etc. Why should the goverment keep all the benefits of one partner and not pay this on to the other partner? If not the full pension, they should at least be able to claim a portion of this.
